original: yon gnas chen po 'jig rten gyi yid bzhin gyi nor bu lta bur dad pa bya ba'i gnas kyi mchog la ni sems kyi nyes pa chung du bskyed pa yang ngan song gi rgyur 'gyur ba dang / de'i bstan pa ltar ma byas na /

translated: Disparaging it is a cause for rebirth in the lower realms, and not listening to it and so on and not relying on it are obstacles to the supreme health of freedom from disease.

original: de bas na bar du gcod pa'i nyes pa de zlog pa'i phyir theg pa mchog 'di bstan te /
analyzed: de bas na bar du gcod pa'i nyes pa de zlog pa'i phyir theg pa mchog 'di bstan te /
translated: Therefore, in order to avert the faults that are obstacles, this supreme vehicle is taught.

translated: Moreover, there is no contradiction, since it is said that after pleasing many buddhas for one measureless kalpa, one then generates the state of the first ground, the ground of joy.

original: de la le lo zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa spyod pa ma yin /
analyzed: de la le lo zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa spyod pa ma yin /
translated: Here, laziness is not the practice of desire.

original: bdag khyad du bsad de /
analyzed: bdag khyad du bsad de /

translated: Thinking, I am not able to do that, one loses enthusiasm for the side of virtue. That is an obscuration to the realization of the happy realms and the three enlightenments.

original: por theg pa mchog 'di bstan te /
analyzed: por theg pa mchog 'di bstan te /
translated: The remedy for that is the teaching of the supreme vehicle.

original: bde ba can du smon lam 'debs pa gang yin pa de dag ni nges skye bar 'gyur ba dang / rin chen mang gi mtshan brjod pa tsam gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu nges par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa mang du 'byung ngo //

translated: There are many statements such as, Those who pray to be reborn in Sukhāvatī will definitely be reborn there, and by merely reciting the name of Ratnasaṃbhava, one will definitely attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, and so on.

original: 'di la yang 'gal ba yod de /
analyzed: 'di la yang 'gal ba yod de /

analyzed: bde ba can du ni sa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' skye bo zhes gzhan las gsungs la /
translated: It is said in other scriptures that beings who have entered the levels are reborn in Sukhāvatī.

analyzed: blo ma sbyangs pa mang po dag kyang der smon lam 'debs pa dang / byang chub tu nges par chud pa ni mi g-yo ba'am /
translated: Many who have not trained their minds pray to be reborn there, and those who are definitely destined for enlightenment are unshakable.

original: rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba la gnas pa yin la /
translated: They abide on the ground of supreme joy.

original: rin chen mang gi mtshan ni bdag cag la sogs pa yang brjod na /🔽de ji lta bu zhig ce na de ni le lo can rnams la khyad par du 'phags pa'i 'bras bu yang dag par bstan pas /

translated: The name of Ratnasaṃbhava is also expressed by us and others.

original: re zhig de'i sa bon du gyur pa'i dge ba chung du tsam la yang 'jug par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: re zhig de'i sa bon du gyur pa'i dge ba chung du tsam la yang 'jug par bya ba'i phyir /

original: dus gzhan la dgongs nas bstan te /
analyzed: dus gzhan la dgongs nas bstan te /
translated: It is taught with a future time in mind.

original: de dag der smon pa'i sems kyis sems kyi rgyud sgom na /
analyzed: de dag der smon pa'i sems kyis sems kyi rgyud sgom na /

analyzed: de dang mthun pa'i dge ba la mngon par dga' ba'i phyir /
translated: because they delight in virtue that is concordant with that,

analyzed: de ston pa'i sangs rgyas la sogs pa bshes gnyen mchog mnyes par bya ba lhur len te /

analyzed: tshe rabs re rer bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs mang po rdzogs par byed pa nas /
translated: They complete the many collections of merit and wisdom in each lifetime and so on.

analyzed: des ma skyes pa yang ma yin te /

analyzed: tshul khrims tsam mam /

original: 'di ltar de ni de 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs ma lus pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pas thob par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni de 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs ma lus pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs pas thob par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is to be attained by completing all the accumulations of merit and knowledge, both mundane and supramundane, without exception.

original: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa'i spu'i khung bu gcig 'grub par byed pa yang /
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin gshegs pa'i spu'i khung bu gcig 'grub par byed pa yang /
translated: Therefore, even to achieve a single pore of a Tathagata

original: dge ba rgya mtsho dpag tu med pas bya dgos na /
analyzed: dge ba rgya mtsho dpag tu med pas bya dgos na /
translated: requires an infinite ocean of virtue.

original: de ji ltar le los thob par nus te /🔽zan tsam gyis chog par 'dzin cing /
analyzed: de ji ltar le los thob par nus te / zan tsam gyis chog par 'dzin cing /
translated: How can this be attained through laziness?🔽Those who are satisfied with just a little food

original: rang gi khyim du mngon par dga' ba rnams kyis ni /
analyzed: rang gi khyim du mngon par dga' ba rnams kyis ni /
translated: and are attached to their own homes

original: seng ge'i khri la mngon par 'jug mi nus so //
analyzed: seng ge'i khri la mngon par 'jug mi nus so //
translated: they are unable to ascend to the lion-throne.

original: de bas na bar du gcod pa de'i gnyen por theg pa mchog 'di bstan te /
analyzed: de bas na bar du gcod pa de'i gnyen por theg pa mchog 'di bstan te /
translated: Therefore, the supreme vehicle is taught as the antidote to that obstacle.

original: gzhan las bcom ldan 'das kyis sbyin pa bsngags nas /
analyzed: gzhan las bcom ldan 'das kyis sbyin pa bsngags nas /
translated: The Blessed One praised generosity

original: yang smad par mdzad la /
analyzed: yang smad par mdzad la /
translated: and then criticized it.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims bsngags nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims bsngags nas /
translated: Similarly, he praised morality

original: gzhan la smad pa mdzad de /
analyzed: gzhan la smad pa mdzad de /
translated: and then criticized it.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad la yang de bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The same should be applied to all perfections.

original: 'di la yang snga phyi 'gal ba yod de /
analyzed: 'di la yang snga phyi 'gal ba yod de /
translated: Here, there is a contradiction between earlier and later statements.

original: gal te sbyin pa yon tan can zhig yin na /
analyzed: gal te sbyin pa yon tan can zhig yin na /
translated: If generosity is virtuous,

original: ci'i phyir smad ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir smad ce na /
translated: why was it criticized?

original: gang zag gi bsam pa la dgongs nas gsungs pas na 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: gang zag gi bsam pa la dgongs nas gsungs pas na 'gal ba med de /
translated: Since it was taught with the intention of the person's attitude, there is no contradiction.

original: ser sna can ha cang 'jungs ches pa gang yin pa de dag sbyin pa la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir sbyin pa'i bsngags pa mdzad de /
analyzed: ser sna can ha cang 'jungs ches pa gang yin pa de dag sbyin pa la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir sbyin pa'i bsngags pa mdzad de /
translated: For those who are stingy and extremely miserly, the praise of generosity is made in order to engage them in generosity.

original: sbyin pa ni phyi bzhin 'brang pa'i gter chen po gtan gyi bshes gnyen gyi mchog go //
analyzed: sbyin pa ni phyi bzhin 'brang pa'i gter chen po gtan gyi bshes gnyen gyi mchog go //
translated: Generosity is a great treasure that follows one, the supreme friend for all time.

original: gos sbyin pa la yon tan bcu yod do //
analyzed: gos sbyin pa la yon tan bcu yod do //
translated: There are ten virtues in giving clothing.

original: zas sbyin pa la yon tan bcu yod do //
analyzed: zas sbyin pa la yon tan bcu yod do //
translated: There are ten virtues in giving food.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdo dag las mang du 'byung ste ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdo dag las mang du 'byung ste ;
translated: and so on.

original: de yang med pa ma yin na 'on kyang de tsam gyis chog par 'dzin te /🔽tshul khrims dang / thos pa la sogs pa'i tshogs la mi 'jug pa gang yin pa de dag la ni smad par mdzad de /
analyzed: de yang med pa ma yin na 'on kyang de tsam gyis chog par 'dzin te / tshul khrims dang / thos pa la sogs pa'i tshogs la mi 'jug pa gang yin pa de dag la ni smad par mdzad de /
translated: But if they are not nonexistent, then they are satisfied with just that much.🔽They do not engage in the collections of morality, learning, and so on.

original: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyi 'bras bu can dang / zag pa'i chos can gyi sbyin pa ni mi dgos so ;
analyzed: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyi 'bras bu can dang / zag pa'i chos can gyi sbyin pa ni mi dgos so ;
translated: The Buddha disparaged them, saying that they do not need generosity that has the result of the suffering of cyclic existence and is subject to the contaminants.

original: / sbyin pa dang ldan pa yang tshul khrims 'chal na ngan song dag tu skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: / sbyin pa dang ldan pa yang tshul khrims 'chal na ngan song dag tu skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Even if one is generous, if one is immoral, one will be reborn in the miserable realms.

original: tshul khrims ni mtho ris kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir gtso bo yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims ni mtho ris kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir gtso bo yin no //
translated: Morality is primary, because it is the cause of rebirth in the heavens.

original: yon tan thams cad bskyed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir sa gzhi lta bu yang yin no //
analyzed: yon tan thams cad bskyed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir sa gzhi lta bu yang yin no //
translated: It is also like the earth, because it is the cause of the growth of all virtues.

original: thos pa yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: thos pa yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Learning is also like that.

original: ye shes gsal @166a * //
analyzed: ye shes gsal @166a * //
translated: It is like a lamp, because it illuminates knowledge.

original: ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i nad rab tu zhi bar byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu ste /🔽de bas na 'di ltar sbyin pa la sogs pa yang kha cig gi sgo nas ni skyon yang yin la /🔽kha cig gi sgo nas yon tan yang yin te /
analyzed: ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i nad rab tu zhi bar byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu ste / de bas na 'di ltar sbyin pa la sogs pa yang kha cig gi sgo nas ni skyon yang yin la / kha cig gi sgo nas yon tan yang yin te /
translated: Because it is the cause of the disease of afflictions, it is called the pacification of the disease of afflictions and so on.🔽Therefore, in this way, even generosity and so on are faults from one perspective and are also qualities from another perspective.🔽🔽

original: gdul bar bya ba'i bsam pa la ltos nas dgongs pa'i dbang gis bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la nyes pa med de /🔽'di ltar sman pas mkhris pa'i rims kyis thebs pa la ni 'o ma dang khar bsngags la /
analyzed: gdul bar bya ba'i bsam pa la ltos nas dgongs pa'i dbang gis bstan pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la nyes pa med de / 'di ltar sman pas mkhris pa'i rims kyis thebs pa la ni 'o ma dang khar bsngags la /
translated: Therefore, the Tathagatas have no fault, because they teach by the power of their intention, in dependence on the thoughts of those to be trained.

original: bad kan gyi rims kyis thebs pa la ni smad pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bad kan gyi rims kyis thebs pa la ni smad pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For example, it is like a doctor who praises milk for one who is afflicted with a fever of bile,🔽but criticizes it for one who is afflicted with a fever of phlegm.🔽Those who practice attachment and pride,

original: 'dod chags dang ni nga rgyal spyod pa dang zhes bya ba la 'dod chags la spyod pa ni ma 'ongs par 'dod chags kun du spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ni nga rgyal spyod pa dang zhes bya ba la 'dod chags la spyod pa ni ma 'ongs par 'dod chags kun du spyod pa'o //
translated: Those who practice attachment are those who will practice attachment in the future.

original: de bzhin du nga rgyal la spyod pa yang nga rgyal kun du spyod pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du nga rgyal la spyod pa yang nga rgyal kun du spyod pa ste /
translated: Likewise, pride is the practice of pride.

original: 'di gnyis kyang so sor sgrib pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyang so sor sgrib pa yin no //
translated: These two are also obscurations, each in its own context.

original: de la khyim dang / zhing dang / bu dang / chung ma dang / nor dang / 'bru dang / gos dang / rgyan dang / glang po che dang / rta la sogs pa phun sum tshogs pa dag la ha cang chags pas de dag spangs te /
analyzed: de la khyim dang / zhing dang / bu dang / chung ma dang / nor dang / 'bru dang / gos dang / rgyan dang / glang po che dang / rta la sogs pa phun sum tshogs pa dag la ha cang chags pas de dag spangs te /
translated: Therein, craving is the practice of craving, because it is an obscuration for those who are attached to the abundance of houses, fields, sons, wives, wealth, grain, clothes, ornaments, elephants, horses, etc.

original: dge ba yang dag par mi len pa gang yin pa de dag ni de las nges par 'byung ba'i bsam pa dang / rab tu 'byung ba dang / byang chub kyi phyogs la sgom pa la bar du gcod par byed pa'i phyir sred pa spyod pa sgrib pa yin no //
analyzed: dge ba yang dag par mi len pa gang yin pa de dag ni de las nges par 'byung ba'i bsam pa dang / rab tu 'byung ba dang / byang chub kyi phyogs la sgom pa la bar du gcod par byed pa'i phyir sred pa spyod pa sgrib pa yin no //
translated: , since it prevents the renunciation of those things, the intention to go forth, and the cultivation of the factors of enlightenment.

original: bar du gcod pa de'i gnyen po theg pa mchog 'di bstan te /🔽gzhan las sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bar du gcod pa de'i gnyen po theg pa mchog 'di bstan te / gzhan las sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par dag pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The remedy for that obscuration is this supreme vehicle,

original: bde ba can gyi bkod pa la sogs pa shin tu bsngags te /
analyzed: bde ba can gyi bkod pa la sogs pa shin tu bsngags te /
translated: which is highly praised in other scriptures, as the pure buddha-field, such as the array of Sukhavati.

original: de dag gis ma mthong ma thos pa'i 'byor pa rgya chen po de thos nas /
analyzed: de dag gis ma mthong ma thos pa'i 'byor pa rgya chen po de thos nas /
translated: Having heard of the great wealth of those who do not see or hear of it,

original: rang gi phun sum tshogs pa la phongs pa kho nar 'dzin to //
analyzed: rang gi phun sum tshogs pa la phongs pa kho nar 'dzin to //
translated: they consider their own perfection to be poverty.

original: de nas der yid smon par byed de de dag thams cad bor nas de thob par bya ba'i phyir 'bad par 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: de nas der yid smon par byed de de dag thams cad bor nas de thob par bya ba'i phyir 'bad par 'gyur bas na /
translated: Then they aspire to it, and having abandoned all that, they strive to obtain it.

original: de ni gang zag gi bsam pa la dgongs nas gsungs so //
analyzed: de ni gang zag gi bsam pa la dgongs nas gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it was taught with the intention of the individual's thoughts.

original: de la mi dang / lha dang / lha ma yin la sogs pa gang dag kha dog dang / stobs dang / mthu dang / 'od dang / skal ba dang ldan pa dang / skad kyi gdangs snyan pa dang / ldog skyen pa dang / shes pa dang /
analyzed: de la mi dang / lha dang / lha ma yin la sogs pa gang dag kha dog dang / stobs dang / mthu dang / 'od dang / skal ba dang ldan pa dang / skad kyi gdangs snyan pa dang / ldog skyen pa dang / shes pa dang /
translated: In that regard, those who are human, divine, asura, and so forth, who are endowed with complexion, strength, power, radiance, good fortune, melodious voice, quick wit, knowledge,

original: rigs dang / tshe dang / longs spyod dang / 'khor la sogs @166b pa phun sum tshogs pa'i sgo nas bdag dang mtshungs pa ma mthong nas nga rgyal gyis khengs shing myos te /
analyzed: rigs dang / tshe dang / longs spyod dang / 'khor la sogs @166b pa phun sum tshogs pa'i sgo nas bdag dang mtshungs pa ma mthong nas nga rgyal gyis khengs shing myos te /
translated: lineage, lifespan, wealth, retinue, and so on, having not seen anyone equal to themselves, are inflated and intoxicated with pride.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la bsnyen bkur mi byed pa de dag ni nga rgyal spyod pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la bsnyen bkur mi byed pa de dag ni nga rgyal spyod pa ste /
translated: Those who do not honor the Tathagatas are proud.

original: de ni phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi rgyu de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba mnyes par bya ba dang / byang chub tu smon lam 'debs pa la sgrib pa yin te //
analyzed: de ni phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi rgyu de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba mnyes par bya ba dang / byang chub tu smon lam 'debs pa la sgrib pa yin te //
translated: That is an obstacle to the cause of all perfections, namely, the appearance of the Tathagatas and the making of vows for enlightenment.

original: de bas na bar du gcod pa'i nyes pa de'i gnyen por theg pa mchog 'di bstan te /
analyzed: de bas na bar du gcod pa'i nyes pa de'i gnyen por theg pa mchog 'di bstan te /
translated: Therefore, this supreme vehicle is taught as the antidote to that obstacle.

original: gzhan las bcom ldan 'das kyis sangs rgyas gang gi phun sum tshogs pa lhag par bsngags pa mdzad de /
analyzed: gzhan las bcom ldan 'das kyis sangs rgyas gang gi phun sum tshogs pa lhag par bsngags pa mdzad de /
translated: The Blessed One has praised the perfection of the Buddha in other scriptures.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'phags pa 'od dpag med ces bya ba de'i sku tshe dpag tu med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'phags pa 'od dpag med ces bya ba de'i sku tshe dpag tu med do //
translated: The Tathagata named Arhat Amitabha has an immeasurable life.

original: rang bzhin gyi 'od kyi dkyil 'khor yang dpag tu med do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi 'od kyi dkyil 'khor yang dpag tu med do //
translated: The circle of his natural light is also immeasurable.

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas gzhan dag gi sku dang / snod phun sum tshogs pa rnams kyi bsngags pa mdzad do //
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas gzhan dag gi sku dang / snod phun sum tshogs pa rnams kyi bsngags pa mdzad do //
translated: In the same way, he praises the bodies of other Buddhas and the perfection of their fields.

original: de nas de dag gis de thos nas bdag cag pas kyang ches rgyang chad pas khyad du 'phags pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnam pa thams cad du mdzes pa dag kyang yod do snyam nas nga rgyal gyi ri grum ste /
analyzed: de nas de dag gis de thos nas bdag cag pas kyang ches rgyang chad pas khyad du 'phags pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnam pa thams cad du mdzes pa dag kyang yod do snyam nas nga rgyal gyi ri grum ste /
translated: Then, having heard that, they think, “There are tathāgatas who are even more exalted than we are, who are even more remote, who are beautiful in every way.”

original: blo yon tan bskyed pa'i snod du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: blo yon tan bskyed pa'i snod du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the mountain of pride is shaken and they become vessels for the development of good qualities.

original: 'gyod pa ni yid la gcags pa ste /
analyzed: 'gyod pa ni yid la gcags pa ste /
translated: Regret is remorse.

original: yon tan dang ldan pa rnams dang / phan 'dogs pa rnams la gnod pa byas nas phyis ci zhig ltar yid la gcags par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yon tan dang ldan pa rnams dang / phan 'dogs pa rnams la gnod pa byas nas phyis ci zhig ltar yid la gcags par 'gyur te /
translated: Having harmed those who have good qualities and those who help you, you later feel remorse.

original: mya ngan gyi zug rngu de kho nas yun ring por sems mi bde zhing yid 'khrugs la /
analyzed: mya ngan gyi zug rngu de kho nas yun ring por sems mi bde zhing yid 'khrugs la /
translated: For a long time, you are unhappy and your mind is disturbed by the pain of that grief.

original: lus shig shig por gyur cing ro bzhin du 'dug la /
analyzed: lus shig shig por gyur cing ro bzhin du 'dug la /
translated: Your body is weak and you sit like a corpse.

original: bsod nams bya ba btang ste sa la nyal nas rang gi lus kyi bsam pa la yang spro ba med par 'dug pa gang yin pa de dag gi 'gyod pa de ni bshags pa dang / bsdam par bya ba dang / bsod nams la sbyor ba la bar du gcod par byed pa'i phyir sgrib pa yin te /
analyzed: bsod nams bya ba btang ste sa la nyal nas rang gi lus kyi bsam pa la yang spro ba med par 'dug pa gang yin pa de dag gi 'gyod pa de ni bshags pa dang / bsdam par bya ba dang / bsod nams la sbyor ba la bar du gcod par byed pa'i phyir sgrib pa yin te /
translated: Those who have given up meritorious actions, who lie on the ground, who have no interest in their own bodies, their regret is an obscuration because it obstructs confession, restraint, and the application to merit.

original: shes rab can gyis ni bdag cag gi 'di ma legs so snyam du rig nas /
analyzed: shes rab can gyis ni bdag cag gi 'di ma legs so snyam du rig nas /
translated: The wise, thinking, “This is not good for us,”

original: de'i 'og tu bshags pa dang / bsdam par bya ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam pa sna tshogs mang po'i sman gnod sel la goms pas zad par byed cing /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bshags pa dang / bsdam par bya ba dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam pa sna tshogs mang po'i sman gnod sel la goms pas zad par byed cing /
translated: should confess, restrain themselves, and destroy it by the medicine of various kinds of roots of merit.

original: ma byas pa la yang dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / skyes bu dam pa la mnyan pa la sogs pa dang / bsten pa la sogs pa mi bya bar bsgrim par byed @167a * //
analyzed: ma byas pa la yang dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / skyes bu dam pa la mnyan pa la sogs pa dang / bsten pa la sogs pa mi bya bar bsgrim par byed @167a * //
translated: They should be careful not to commit it again, and should practice mindfulness, vigilance, listening to holy men, and so on.

original: do ; /'phags pa dpa' bos gsungs pa'i skyes rabs las kyang /
analyzed: do ; /'phags pa dpa' bos gsungs pa'i skyes rabs las kyang /
translated: The Jataka Tales of the Arya-Sūra also say,

original: yid chad rgud pa'i ngo lon thabs ma yin //
analyzed: yid chad rgud pa'i ngo lon thabs ma yin //
translated: It is not a means of paying off the debts of despair and misfortune.

original: de phyir mi dgar 'dzin pa gtang bar bya //
analyzed: de phyir mi dgar 'dzin pa gtang bar bya //
translated: Therefore, give up the attitude of displeasure.

original: dgos pa sgrub la mkhas rnams sran thub pas //
analyzed: dgos pa sgrub la mkhas rnams sran thub pas //
translated: The wise who are skilled in accomplishing their goals are patient.

original: dka' ba rnams kyang dga' ba med par rgal //
analyzed: dka' ba rnams kyang dga' ba med par rgal //
translated: Even when it is difficult, they cross over without any unhappiness.

original: de phyir yid chad mi dga' spangs nas ni //
analyzed: de phyir yid chad mi dga' spangs nas ni //
translated: Therefore, give up despair and displeasure.

original: don gyi skabs dbye ba la bsnyen par gyis /
analyzed: don gyi skabs dbye ba la bsnyen par gyis /
translated: Approach the occasion of the goal.

original: shes pa'i gzi byin sran gyis spar ba ni //
analyzed: shes pa'i gzi byin sran gyis spar ba ni //
translated: The power of the brilliance of knowledge that is increased by patience

original: don kun grub 'dzin lags pa'i mchog yin no //🔽zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: don kun grub 'dzin lags pa'i mchog yin no // zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: is the best for holding all goals.

original: de bas na de'i yun ring po'i 'gyod pa chen po'i bar du gcod pa'i nyes pa de'i gnyen por theg pa mchog 'di bstan te //
analyzed: de bas na de'i yun ring po'i 'gyod pa chen po'i bar du gcod pa'i nyes pa de'i gnyen por theg pa mchog 'di bstan te //
translated: Therefore, this vehicle of the supreme yana was taught as the antidote to the fault of despair, which is a great regret in the long run.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ni gnod pa byed pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad kyang mtho ris su 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ni gnod pa byed pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad kyang mtho ris su 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ste /
translated: It is said that even those who harm the buddhas and bodhisattvas will all go to the higher realms.

original: 'di ni gang zag gi bsam pa la dgongs nas gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ni gang zag gi bsam pa la dgongs nas gsungs te /
translated: This was taught with the intention of the attitude of the person.

original: gang zag la la ni shin tu 'gyod pa'i dug gis brgyal ba'i bsam pa can gyi 'gyod pa de las 'byung bar 'gyur ba de la dgongs nas gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zag la la ni shin tu 'gyod pa'i dug gis brgyal ba'i bsam pa can gyi 'gyod pa de las 'byung bar 'gyur ba de la dgongs nas gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and some people are overcome by the poison of remorse, and it is with reference to them that the Buddha said this.

original: gnod pa byas pas ji ltar mtho ris su skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gnod pa byas pas ji ltar mtho ris su skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can one be reborn in the higher realms by harming others?

original: de kho nas skye bo zhes mi zer te /
analyzed: de kho nas skye bo zhes mi zer te /
translated: It is not said that one is reborn there just by that harm.

original: 'on kyang de'i rgyu las byung ba'i 'gyod pa la sogs pa dge ba spel bar byed pas skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang de'i rgyu las byung ba'i 'gyod pa la sogs pa dge ba spel bar byed pas skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But by increasing the virtue of remorse and so on that arises from that harm, one is reborn there.

original: gzhan yang de dag la gnod pa byed pa'i tshe nges par de mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / dran pa dang / 'grogs pa la sogs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzhan yang de dag la gnod pa byed pa'i tshe nges par de mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / dran pa dang / 'grogs pa la sogs par 'gyur la /
translated: Moreover, when one harms others, one certainly sees, hears of, or remembers the harm, and one associates with those who do so.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni /
translated: The Buddhas and Bodhisattvas

original: gzhi de dag tu don yod pa yin te ;
analyzed: gzhi de dag tu don yod pa yin te ;
translated: are always present in those situations.

original: 'phags pa de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba srid pa bstan pa las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa de bzhin gshegs pa 'byung ba srid pa bstan pa las kyang /
translated: As it says in the Sūtra on the Appearance of the Tathāgata

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / dran pa dang / reg pa dang / 'grogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba don yod par shog cig ces 'byung ba lta bu yin no //

analyzed: bar du gcod pa'i nyes pa thams cad ces tshig rnam par sbyar bar bya'o //

original: de ma yin pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis ni tshigs su bcad pa 'di gnyis kyi phan yon bstan te /
analyzed: de ma yin pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis ni tshigs su bcad pa 'di gnyis kyi phan yon bstan te /
translated: The next three verses teach the benefits of these two verses.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyi gzungs la ni //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyi gzungs la ni //
translated: In the dharani of the two verses,

original: tshig gam don gyi sgo nas gang sbyar ba //
analyzed: tshig gam don gyi sgo nas gang sbyar ba //

original: sems can dam pa blo dang ldan pa de /
analyzed: sems can dam pa blo dang ldan pa de /
translated: that holy being with intelligence

original: phan yon rnam pa bcu dag thob par 'gyur //

analyzed: khams rnams mtha' dag rgyas par 'gyur ba dang // 'chi ba'i tshe na mchog dga' dam pa 'thob //

analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du skye ba dang // thams cad du ni tshe rabs dran par 'gyur //

analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams dang phrad par 'gyur ba dang // de bzhin de dag las ni theg mchog thos //

analyzed: mos par 'gyur ba blo dang bcas pa dang // sgo gnyis dang ni byang chub myur du 'thob //
translated: One becomes devoted, intelligent, and quickly attains enlightenment through the two doors.

analyzed: de lta bu theg pa chen po'i dgongs pa zab mo ston pa mtha' dag ni sems can tha mal pa'am /

analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi dam par ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs can yin la /

analyzed: de yang gal te blo dang ldan pa dang / blo sbyang ba zhig yin na /

analyzed: gang gi phyir khams thams cad rgyas pa nas sgo gnyis 'thob par 'gyur ba'i bar gyi phyir te /
translated: Because of the expansion of all the elements up to the attainment of the two doors.

original: de dag ni byang chub bskyed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni byang chub bskyed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: de bas kyang de mjug tu smos te /
